page.title: 09Meledor Farm St.Stephen
page.content: This{listed building}is now a farm house which was once part of a large { {manor house.}The building is thought to have been completed in{1510.}It lies on the western side of the{Fal {Valley}with buildings of the clay industry overpowering its western boundary. The old arched doorway is now blocked. Above it is a{keystone} with a grotesque bearded human head. On the same granite facade is a{ {mullioned window}and a chimney on top of which is the original{chimney pot.} In the fine cottage garden are several {corn mushrooms}and a{corn measure.}The corn was stacked around the mushrooms to enable it to dry. The measure surmounts a vertical stem and consists of a "bowl" with a tubular hole. The most distant walls of the cowsheds show evidence of having once been a chapel.
